sentence: They were singing when I entered the room.
I was reading a comic book at 9 p.m. last night.
We were watching a TV show at 6 p.m. last night.
He was driving home when I saw him.
I took a photo when she was playing the guitar.
This time last year, he was living in London.
It was snowing when we left the building.
At 7 a.m. yesterday I was sleeping on the sofa.
My dad was washing his car at 8 p.m. yesterday.
They were looking at the clock during the test.
We were playing golf at 3 p.m. yesterday.
She was cooking fish when I called her.
My sister was wearing a purple coat when I saw her.
They were studying when I came to visit them.
She was playing volleyball when she hurt her knee.
They were still working at 10 p.m. last night.
They were watching a football match that evening.
They were running in the park when he fell.
They were crossing the road when the car appeared.
I was cooking dinner when my grandson came to help me.
My husband was reading in the living room this morning.
They were playing a concert when the lights turned off.
They were washing the dishes when dad came home.
We were eating pizza when the doorbell rang.
We were having a picnic when it started to rain.
He was waiting for us at the bus stop.
The birds were singing when I woke up this morning.
The student was drawing a beautiful picture when the teacher entered the classroom.
He was eating breakfast when his brother entered the kitchen.
I was cleaning my flat when my son called me.
I was having a vacation in France this time last year.
He was sleeping when the alarm clock rang.
We were sitting in the restaurant when we saw our friend.
She was swimming in the pool until 9 p.m. yesterday.
I was working on my science project in the morning.
She was wearing a nice green dress at the party.
We were walking in the zoo when our mother called.
We were eating burgers when she came in.
